intro: Trichouratea costata, commonly known as the serrated leaf fern, is a species of flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araceae, which includes many aquatic and semi-aquatic plants. The plant is characterized by its pinnately compound leaves with serrated margins, giving it a distinctive appearance. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or near water bodies. Its flowers are small and clustered in spadices, typical of the Araceae family.
